Related to Results (1) (Research Papers: The study showed significant benefits from administering acetyl L-carnitine (ALC) to the elderly with chronic fatigue syndrome. It reduced physical fatigue (p<0.001), mental fatigue (p<0.001), severity of fatigue (p<0.001), and resulted in improvements in functional status (p<0.001) and cognitive functions (p<0.001). Additional benefits observed include a decrease in muscle pain (-27%, p<0.05), prolonged fatigue after exercise (51%, p<0.0001), and sleep disorders (28%, p<0.05). (https://www.notion.so/The-study-showed-significant-benefits-from-administering-acetyl-L-carnitine-ALC-to-the-elderly-wit-ed65e3e270f6496ab5c82fab9474f33b?pvs=21)

Related to Results (1) (Research Papers: The study found that acute Rhodiola rosea intake increased time to exhaustion, indicating an improvement in endurance threshold. This indicates that the intake of Rhodiola rosea may help in reducing physical fatigue, allowing individuals to exercise for longer periods. Label: Stress,Calmness
Related to Results (1) (Research Papers: While the abstract does not explicitly mention the term "calmness" or "relaxation", the results suggest that L-Theanine could cause anti-stress effects via the inhibition of cortical neuron excitation. This could potentially be interpreted as inducing a state of calmness, but without explicit mention or measurement of calmness or relaxation in the study, this categorization is uncertain. (https://www.notion.so/While-the-abstract-does-not-explicitly-mention-the-term-calmness-or-relaxation-the-results-sugg-98b2f2d488aa408f89d07bff99e85c30?pvs=21), The study examined the effects of L-Theanine on psychological and physiological states under stress, using a mental arithmetic task as an acute stressor. The results showed that L-Theanine intake resulted in a reduction in the heart rate and salivary immunoglobulin A responses to an acute stress task relative to the placebo control condition. This suggests that L-Theanine could cause anti-stress effects via the inhibition of cortical neuron excitation. (https://www.notion.so/The-study-examined-the-effects-of-L-Theanine-on-psychological-and-physiological-states-under-stress--eb88474c0c28446eb38c6f879e3a942c?pvs=21)
Untitled (https://www.notion.so/d8d921fd1461402f8b8f8acdbb2d2fa7?pvs=21)

The investigation was funded by project grants from the Research and Development Division of the Swedish Herbal Institute, a company that researches and commercialises Rhodiola-derived functional products. However, the funding sponsor played no role in any practical aspect of the study, including the collection, management, analysis, and interpretation of data and the review and approval of the manuscript. The study protocol was formulated by AP (who is associated with the Swedish Herbal Institute) and EO. EO enrolled the participants, performed the study interventions, and analysed the data. All of the authors assisted with drafting the manuscript and were involved in its critical appraisal and final approval.”

Related to Results (1) (Research Papers: A study on Lemon balm (Melissa officinalis) showed that taking a dose of 1600 mg or more can help improve memory and mood, specifically making people feel calmer. However, taking lower doses seemed to slow down how quickly people could perform memory tasks. The study did not find that the extract can stop the breakdown of a certain brain chemical related to memory. (https://www.notion.so/A-study-on-Lemon-balm-Melissa-officinalis-showed-that-taking-a-dose-of-1600-mg-or-more-can-help-im-83656602756543a299dd05f07796a1fe?pvs=21), The administration of 1600 mg of Melissa officinalis was associated with improved mood, as indicated by the increased 'calmness' reported in the study. Related to Results (1) (Research Papers: This research study analyzed the results from ten different experiments that involved nearly 700 children with ADHD. It found that supplements containing omega-3 fatty acids, particularly a type called eicosapentaenoic acid, can help reduce ADHD symptoms a bit. These supplements didn't work as well as usual ADHD medications, but they still made a difference and could be useful. (https://www.notion.so/This-research-study-analyzed-the-results-from-ten-different-experiments-that-involved-nearly-700-chi-9dfd6fecff544285853b08db226f3eb2?pvs=21)

The results show a trend for lower DOMS in the MC group, suggesting that MC may help reduce muscle soreness after exercise. (https://www.notion.so/The-study-measures-muscle-soreness-DOMS-as-one-of-the-indicators-of-recovery-from-EIMD-The-result-7611b1b40a0e4679b0796c7f788480d2?pvs=21),  The study investigates the effects of Tart Montmorency cherry concentrate (MC) on exercise-induced muscle damage (EIMD) in females. The results suggest that MC supplementation may help attenuate the symptoms of muscle damage. (https://www.notion.so/The-study-investigates-the-effects-of-Tart-Montmorency-cherry-concentrate-MC-on-exercise-induced-m-4869b106ce484589a0748a69f5692bfe?pvs=21), The study measures pain pressure threshold (PPT) as part of the recovery indicators. The results show a trend for higher PPT in the MC group, suggesting that MC may help reduce pain after exercise. (https://www.notion.so/The-study-measures-pain-pressure-threshold-PPT-as-part-of-the-recovery-indicators-The-results-sho-61f136b0f04840a0942947db212f3a55?pvs=21), However, it didn't make a significant change in their body's inflammation levels. (https://www.notion.so/However-it-didn-t-make-a-significant-change-in-their-body-s-inflammation-levels-5337e3e41181499b93ea4db2567e2a35?pvs=21)

Related to Results (1) (Research Papers: The consumption of Montmorency cherry juice significantly accelerated recovery of muscle strength after intensive unilateral leg exercise. It also lowered both the percentage and absolute increase in protein carbonyls, indicating an attenuation of oxidative damage from the exercise. (https://www.notion.so/The-consumption-of-Montmorency-cherry-juice-significantly-accelerated-recovery-of-muscle-strength-af-0b59da77df0248ca8ba9f7ff04b93ad7?pvs=21), Despite the positive benefits, cherry juice consumption didn't affect the exercise-induced increase in creatine kinase activity. (https://www.notion.so/Despite-the-positive-benefits-cherry-juice-consumption-didn-t-affect-the-exercise-induced-increase--e7c822e6c74047a7834f223705313a0b?pvs=21), The study investigates the effects of Montmorency cherry juice on muscle function after intensive unilateral leg exercise. The results show that the recovery of isometric muscle strength was significantly faster after consumption of the cherry juice. This indicates that the cherry juice may have had a positive effect on muscle damage recovery. (https://www.notion.so/The-study-investigates-the-effects-of-Montmorency-cherry-juice-on-muscle-function-after-intensive-un-3f7269dae894404795a5491ffe56ad89?pvs=21), The results show that the increase in protein carbonyls (PC), a marker of oxidative stress, was lower in the cherry juice trials than in the fruit concentrate trials. This indicates that the cherry juice may have had a positive effect on reducing oxidative stress. (https://www.notion.so/The-results-show-that-the-increase-in-protein-carbonyls-PC-a-marker-of-oxidative-stress-was-lowe-aca1bf505c4849ddb4c3d2ff7bc08059?pvs=21)

Label: Muscle Damage,Oxidative Stress,Muscle Soreness
Related to Results (1) (Research Papers: The study found that L-carnitine L-tartrate (LCLT) supplementation significantly attenuated exercise-induced increases in plasma markers of purine catabolism (hypoxanthine, xanthine oxidase, and serum uric acid) and circulating cytosolic proteins (myoglobin, fatty acid-binding protein, and creatine kinase). These markers are associated with muscle damage, indicating that LCLT may reduce muscle damage caused by high-repetition squat exercise. The amount of muscle disruption from MRI scans during LCLT was 41-45% of the placebo area. These data indicate that LCLT supplementation is effective in assisting recovery from high-repetition squat exercise. (https://www.notion.so/The-study-found-that-L-carnitine-L-tartrate-LCLT-supplementation-significantly-attenuated-exercise-10d0650fc1a04d56af3e85286ef55f41?pvs=21), The study found that exercise-induced increases in plasma malondialdehyde, a marker of oxidative stress, returned to resting values sooner during LCLT supplementation compared with placebo. This suggests that LCLT may help reduce oxidative stress caused by high-repetition squat exercise. (https://www.notion.so/The-study-found-that-exercise-induced-increases-in-plasma-malondialdehyde-a-marker-of-oxidative-str-9b3c95699bab494095f955f0ce229efa?pvs=21), The indicators of muscle tissue disruption and markers associated with muscle damage were notably reduced with LCLT supplementation. So, it seems like LCLT could indeed be beneficial for reducing muscle soreness following intense exercise. (https://www.notion.so/The-indicators-of-muscle-tissue-disruption-and-markers-associated-with-muscle-damage-were-notably-re-d7f0c4ec5376496a8cd4a03908629031?pvs=21)

TLDR: In the study, college students who regularly exercise were given a piece of gum that had a low amount of caffeine or a fake gum that didn't have any caffeine. They were then asked to hold a heavy metal block until they couldn't anymore. There were no reported negative effects of the caffeine gum.

TLDR: Quercetin, when added to a sports drink, did not help young adult men run repeated sprints better, nor did it lower the markers of stress or inflammation from sprinting. It even made them tire out faster compared to just taking a placebo.

TLDR: Seaprose S, a drug used to treat vein inflammation, was found to be more effective and better tolerated than the drug serratio-peptidase. Label: Pain
Related to Results (1) (Research Papers: The abstract states that both glucosamine sulfate with potassium salt (GS-K) and glucosamine sulfate with sodium salt (GS-Na) demonstrated improvement in the WOMAC score, which measures pain, stiffness, and physical function in patients with knee osteoarthritis. However, this improvement did not reach statistical significance in either group. Furthermore, there were no significant differences in the WOMAC score between the two treatment groups at any follow-up visit. Thus, the abstract does not support the claim that the supplement statistically improved pain symptoms in patients with mild and moderate knee osteoarthritis, as the observed improvements were not statistically significant. (https://www.notion.so/The-abstract-states-that-both-glucosamine-sulfate-with-potassium-salt-GS-K-and-glucosamine-sulfate-81dac1b7aa6e4beb95b7b0a69d7f4d69?pvs=21)

Label: Pain,Joint Function,Notes
Related to Results (1) (Research Papers:
• Overall Effect: The study found that glucosamine favored placebo with a 28% improvement in pain when considering all studies.
• Rotta vs. Non-Rotta Preparations: The Rotta preparation of glucosamine showed a significant reduction in pain compared to placebo. In contrast, non-Rotta preparations did not show a statistically significant effect on pain relief.
• Quality of Studies: When only considering studies with adequate allocation concealment, glucosamine did not show a significant benefit in reducing pain. • Comparison with NSAIDs: In some trials, the Rotta preparation of glucosamine was found to be superior or equivalent to NSAIDs for pain relief. (https://www.notion.so/Overall-Effect-The-study-found-that-glucosamine-favored-placebo-with-a-28-improvement-in-pain-when-425d3273b0784dd38babf6288fe8c339?pvs=21), • Overall Effect on Function: The study showed a 21% improvement in function using the Lequesne index across all studies.
• Rotta vs. Non-Rotta Preparations: Similar to pain, glucosamine in the Rotta preparation was more effective in improving joint function compared to placebo, as opposed to non-Rotta preparations.
• WOMAC Function Outcomes: WOMAC function outcomes did not reach statistical significance when considering both Rotta and non-Rotta preparations.
• Radiological Progression: The Rotta preparation of glucosamine was found to slow down the radiological progression of OA of the knee over three years, suggesting potential benefits in joint health and function. (https://www.notion.so/Overall-Effect-on-Function-The-study-showed-a-21-improvement-in-function-using-the-Lequesne-index--519e115d54b24071af69f1cece93d9e3?pvs=21), The variability in results, depending on the preparation of glucosamine and the quality of the studies, highlights the need for more consistent research in this area. (https://www.notion.so/The-variability-in-results-depending-on-the-preparation-of-glucosamine-and-the-quality-of-the-studi-beb02ba137184f0e9c208b86778e8c93?pvs=21)

• Overall Effect: The study found that glucosamine favored placebo with a 28% improvement in pain when considering all studies.
• Rotta vs. Non-Rotta Preparations: The Rotta preparation of glucosamine showed a significant reduction in pain compared to placebo. In contrast, non-Rotta preparations did not show a statistically significant effect on pain relief.
• Quality of Studies: When only considering studies with adequate allocation concealment, glucosamine did not show a significant benefit in reducing pain. • Comparison with NSAIDs: In some trials, the Rotta preparation of glucosamine was found to be superior or equivalent to NSAIDs for pain relief. (https://www.notion.so/Overall-Effect-The-study-found-that-glucosamine-favored-placebo-with-a-28-improvement-in-pain-when-341e14d16ca84133bb6803de294e4941?pvs=21), • Overall Effect on Function: The study showed a 21% improvement in function using the Lequesne index across all studies.
• Rotta vs. Non-Rotta Preparations: Similar to pain, glucosamine in the Rotta preparation was more effective in improving joint function compared to placebo, as opposed to non-Rotta preparations.
• WOMAC Function Outcomes: WOMAC function outcomes did not reach statistical significance when considering both Rotta and non-Rotta preparations.
• Radiological Progression: The Rotta preparation of glucosamine was found to slow down the radiological progression of OA of the knee over three years, suggesting potential benefits in joint health and function. (https://www.notion.so/Overall-Effect-on-Function-The-study-showed-a-21-improvement-in-function-using-the-Lequesne-index--642916c98d4e497eb75cb2c184afc252?pvs=21), The variability in results, depending on the preparation of glucosamine and the quality of the studies, highlights the need for more consistent research in this area. (https://www.notion.so/The-variability-in-results-depending-on-the-preparation-of-glucosamine-and-the-quality-of-the-studi-9a30d2807b3642389e52c281e7252eb0?pvs=21)
TLDR: The Rotta preparation of glucosamine showed improvements in pain and function for osteoarthritis patients, but other preparations or studies with specific standards did not show these benefits. However, glucosamine was found to be as safe as taking a placebo.

Label: Exercise Perfomance,Oxidative Stress,Inflammation
Related to Results (1) (Research Papers: Drinking purple grape juice improved the running stamina and antioxidant levels in recreational runners compared to those drinking a control beverage. However, it did not improve their sprinting or overall aerobic capacity. Supplementation with purple grape juice led to a 15.3% increase in running time-to-exhaustion. (https://www.notion.so/Drinking-purple-grape-juice-improved-the-running-stamina-and-antioxidant-levels-in-recreational-runn-7b14702dc2db45a7a7bc989e7784d564?pvs=21), The study does not conclusively demonstrate that the purple grape juice supplement statistically improved inflammation symptoms in patients. While the grape juice group (GJG) showed a significant decrease in α-1-acid glycoprotein (20.2%; p = 0.006), a potential marker of inflammation, the levels of high-sensitivity C-reactive protein, a more direct marker of inflammation, remained unchanged. Therefore, the evidence is insufficient to claim a statistically significant improvement in inflammation symptoms due to the supplement. (https://www.notion.so/The-study-does-not-conclusively-demonstrate-that-the-purple-grape-juice-supplement-statistically-imp-945d01f2a6374df981a7bb6e18653665?pvs=21), GJG exhibited significant increases in total antioxidant capacity (38.7%). (https://www.notion.so/GJG-exhibited-significant-increases-in-total-antioxidant-capacity-38-7-9ee404a757d14b94ae2a7276591c162d?pvs=21)
Untitled (https://www.notion.so/2570d8cfde874c4cbfa99afabca1fe49?pvs=21)
Results: Drinking purple grape juice improved the running stamina and antioxidant levels in recreational runners compared to those drinking a control beverage. (https://www.notion.so/Drinking-purple-grape-juice-improved-the-running-stamina-and-antioxidant-levels-in-recreational-runn-418b5166770d4d2180aac201c1d63adc?pvs=21), GJG exhibited significant increases in total antioxidant capacity (38.7%). (https://www.notion.so/GJG-exhibited-significant-increases-in-total-antioxidant-capacity-38-7-ee824e40e22f44b7af2ae6fdcc68a0aa?pvs=21), The study does not conclusively demonstrate that the purple grape juice supplement statistically improved inflammation symptoms in patients. While the grape juice group (GJG) showed a significant decrease in α-1-acid glycoprotein (20.2%; p = 0.006), a potential marker of inflammation, the levels of high-sensitivity C-reactive protein, a more direct marker of inflammation, remained unchanged. Therefore, the evidence is insufficient to claim a statistically significant improvement in inflammation symptoms due to the supplement. (https://www.notion.so/The-study-does-not-conclusively-demonstrate-that-the-purple-grape-juice-supplement-statistically-imp-d1d53e5b6d6e45e382c8122f39302c4e?pvs=21)
Source: Aerobic Exercise Metrics, Anaerobic Capacity, Total Antioxidant Capacity (TAC)
TLDR: Drinking purple grape juice improved the running stamina and antioxidant levels in recreational runners compared to those drinking a control beverage. However, it did not improve their sprinting or overall aerobic capacity.

Label: DNA Damage,Oxidative Stress,Notes,DNA Damage
Related to Results (1) (Research Papers: Everyone's castle is a bit different, so the potion works a little differently for everyone based on their special castle blueprints (genes). Some castles are better protected by the potion, while others are not. (https://www.notion.so/Everyone-s-castle-is-a-bit-different-so-the-potion-works-a-little-differently-for-everyone-based-on-6bcd30f018444e9da7b6bdfeebed34b5?pvs=21), We found 20% protection (P < 0.01) against ex vivo H(2)O(2)-provoked oxidative DNA damage, measured by comet assay. This marker is used to assess the extent of DNA damage caused by reactive oxygen species (ROS), particularly hydrogen peroxide (H2O2). (https://www.notion.so/We-found-20-protection-P-0-01-against-ex-vivo-H-2-O-2-provoked-oxidative-DNA-damage-measured--e26d854ab30440a6bacb57543e723996?pvs=21), The study found a 20% protection against ex vivo H2O2-provoked oxidative DNA damage, as measured by the comet assay, after consuming the blueberry/apple juice. These adducts are a specific marker for the interaction between certain environmental carcinogens and DNA, potentially leading to mutations and cancer if not repaired. Label: Inflammation,Oxidative Stress
Related to Results (1) (Research Papers: The reduction in oxidized LDL in the Tart Cherry group (P = .047) can also be interpreted as an indication of reduced oxidative stress, since oxidized LDL is a marker of lipid peroxidation, a process driven by oxidative stress. However, similar to the inflammation markers, the levels were not significantly lower than the baseline values. Therefore, while there is evidence of some benefit in reducing oxidative stress compared to the Control, the effect is not strong enough to be considered a definitive improvement from the initial state. (https://www.notion.so/The-reduction-in-oxidized-LDL-in-the-Tart-Cherry-group-P-047-can-also-be-interpreted-as-an-indi-48a94e75f3f24d1497c4898010ff5277?pvs=21), he study found that oxidized low-density lipoprotein (LDL) and soluble vascular cell adhesion molecule-1 (sVCAM-1) were significantly lower in the Tart Cherry group compared to the Control group at 12 weeks (P = .047 and P = .036, respectively). These markers are associated with inflammation, particularly in the context of cardiovascular health. However, it's important to note that these markers were not significantly lower than their baseline values, indicating a relative improvement compared to the Control but not an absolute reduction from the starting levels. (https://www.notion.so/he-study-found-that-oxidized-low-density-lipoprotein-LDL-and-soluble-vascular-cell-adhesion-molecu-8950b242e0f04125a030770c3f8eed5d?pvs=21)

Results: These findings suggest that both forms of vitamin E supplementation can reduce systemic oxidative stress in patients with type 2 diabetes. TLDR: Trained men have better antioxidant systems in their red blood cells than untrained men. Taking alpha-lipoic acid helps increase some antioxidants and reduce damage markers after muscle-damaging exercises. However, the total thiol, another antioxidant measure, is still lower in trained men, and alpha-lipoic acid doesn't bridge that entire gap.

Label: Inflammation,Oxidative Stress
Related to Results (1) (Research Papers: The results indicated no significant effect of spirulina on tumor necrosis factor-α (TNF-α), a key inflammatory marker. While there was a marginal decrease in interleukin-6 (IL-6) and an initial increase in interleukin-2 (IL-2) concentrations, the latter became insignificant after sensitivity analysis. Overall, the evidence does not strongly support a statistically significant improvement in inflammation markers with spirulina supplementation. (https://www.notion.so/The-results-indicated-no-significant-effect-of-spirulina-on-tumor-necrosis-factor-TNF-a-key-i-f7cb4889ad2243f094df255d4c085e8d?pvs=21), The meta-analysis showed a marginal decrease in thiobarbituric acid reactive substances (TBARS) levels, which suggests a potential improvement in oxidative stress. However, there was no significant effect on malondialdehyde (MDA) concentrations, another marker of oxidative stress. Therefore, the results are mixed regarding the impact of spirulina on oxidative stress. (https://www.notion.so/The-meta-analysis-showed-a-marginal-decrease-in-thiobarbituric-acid-reactive-substances-TBARS-leve-1dda36c24f9a4528adb7c3911980341a?pvs=21)
Untitled (https://www.notion.so/33b522c0bff546cb9ecf17985585cb99?pvs=21)
Results: The results indicated no significant effect of spirulina on tumor necrosis factor-α (TNF-α), a key inflammatory marker. While there was a marginal decrease in interleukin-6 (IL-6) and an initial increase in interleukin-2 (IL-2) concentrations, the latter became insignificant after sensitivity analysis. Overall, the evidence does not strongly support a statistically significant improvement in inflammation markers with spirulina supplementation. (https://www.notion.so/The-results-indicated-no-significant-effect-of-spirulina-on-tumor-necrosis-factor-TNF-a-key-i-3496aaf8004a4bb7be7cc1801dfe41d9?pvs=21), The meta-analysis showed a marginal decrease in thiobarbituric acid reactive substances (TBARS) levels, which suggests a potential improvement in oxidative stress. However, there was no significant effect on malondialdehyde (MDA) concentrations, another marker of oxidative stress. Therefore, the results are mixed regarding the impact of spirulina on oxidative stress. (https://www.notion.so/The-meta-analysis-showed-a-marginal-decrease-in-thiobarbituric-acid-reactive-substances-TBARS-leve-b91f981424214981a9f9f44c4399d697?pvs=21)
TLDR: Spirulina supplementation might increase IL-2 concentrations, but this finding is not always consistent. It may also help reduce IL-6 and TBARS levels, especially for those with a lower body weight. However, spirulina doesn't seem to affect TNF-α and MDA levels.

Label: Oxidative Stress,Notes
Related to Results (1) (Research Papers:
The study reported significant reductions in oxidative state and sensitivity to oxidation of serum lipids after pomegranate juice consumption (P < 0.02), indicating a beneficial impact on oxidative stress. (https://www.notion.so/The-study-reported-significant-reductions-in-oxidative-state-and-sensitivity-to-oxidation-of-serum-l-5da413d9060d45edbf5ac3615bbb90f3?pvs=21), 1. 12% decrease in cell proliferation: This means that after the patients drank pomegranate juice, the rate at which prostate cancer cells (LNCaP cells) were growing decreased by 12%. In other words, the cancer cells were multiplying slower.
2. 17% increase in apoptosis: Apoptosis is a fancy term for the process of cells dying in a controlled manner, which is a normal and healthy function in the body. This part of the result shows that there was a 17% increase in the death of cancer cells after the patients consumed pomegranate juice. This is generally a good thing because it means the body is getting rid of the harmful cancer cells more effectively.
3. 23% increase in serum nitric oxide: Nitric oxide in the blood can be beneficial because it helps with blood flow and can have anti-inflammatory effects. A 23% increase indicates that pomegranate juice might help improve blood circulation. (https://www.notion.so/1-12-decrease-in-cell-proliferation-This-means-that-after-the-patients-drank-pomegranate-juice-t-86c3e100091b4d8eb2914def91b8600f?pvs=21)

Label: Exercise Perfomance
Related to Results (1) (Research Papers: The meta-analysis indicates that creatine supplementation (CS) had a small, but significant effect size (ES) on exercise performance, especially in tasks lasting less than or equal to 30 seconds (ATP-PCr energy system) and for repetitive-bout, laboratory-based exercise tasks. The greatest ES was observed in upper-body exercise. However, CS did not appear to be effective in improving running and swimming performance. This suggests that while CS can statistically improve certain aspects of exercise performance, its benefits are specific to certain types of exercise. Label: Muscle Damage,Muscle Soreness,Inflammation,Exercise Perfomance
Related to Results (1) (Research Papers: Creatine supplementation did not statistically improve muscle damage recovery. Results: The data indicate that 6 weeks of HMB supplementation in either SH or TRH form does not influence changes in strength and body composition in response to resistance training in strength-trained athletes. (https://www.notion.so/The-data-indicate-that-6-weeks-of-HMB-supplementation-in-either-SH-or-TRH-form-does-not-influence-ch-a68566d2a8874fd3a51a4610bd6318bd?pvs=21), The abstract explicitly states that biochemical markers of muscle protein turnover and muscle damage were unaffected by HMB supplementation. Therefore, according to the tests conducted in this study, HMB supplementation did not statistically improve or benefit the aspect of muscle damage in resistance-trained athletes. TLDR: In this study, male athletes who regularly do resistance training took a supplement called HMB in two different forms or a fake pill (placebo) for 6 weeks. The study tested their strength, body composition, and some muscle markers before and after taking the supplements. The results showed that taking HMB did not make any difference in their strength, muscle size, or muscle markers compared to not taking it.

Label: Exercise Perfomance
Related to Results (1) (Research Papers: In line with the purported mechanisms for an ergogenic effect of β-alanine supplementation, exercise lasting 60-240 s was improved (P=0.001) in BA compared to Pla, as was exercise of >240 s (P=0.046). In contrast, there was no benefit of β-alanine on exercise lasting <60 s (P=0.312). The median effect of β-alanine supplementation is a 2.85% (-0.37 to 10.49%) improvement in the outcome of an exercise measure, when a median total of 179 g of β-alanine is supplemented. Related to Results (1) (Research Papers: Taking beta-alanine supplements increased muscle carnosine and made the athletes' muscles less tired during certain exercises, but it didn’t help them run faster or improve endurance in holding a contraction. (https://www.notion.so/Taking-beta-alanine-supplements-increased-muscle-carnosine-and-made-the-athletes-muscles-less-tired-66f6cb17bc704c52941a4ab70665230f?pvs=21), The abstract indicates that beta-alanine supplementation significantly improved dynamic knee extension torque during the fourth and fifth bouts of maximal voluntary knee extensions, suggesting a benefit in specific aspects of exercise performance related to fatigue resistance in repeated dynamic contractions. (https://www.notion.so/The-abstract-indicates-that-beta-alanine-supplementation-significantly-improved-dynamic-knee-extensi-9d55979aa14848dd99f23386665f8534?pvs=21), However, it also states that isometric endurance and 400-m race time were not affected by the supplementation. (https://www.notion.so/However-it-also-states-that-isometric-endurance-and-400-m-race-time-were-not-affected-by-the-supple-81cdacbe5cee4a2fa104a0206d653298?pvs=21)

Related to Results (1) (Research Papers: Taking supplemental vitamin D3 helps males with low vitamin D levels recover muscle strength faster after intense muscle contractions. The benefits were also confirmed in lab tests on human muscle cells. (https://www.notion.so/Taking-supplemental-vitamin-D3-helps-males-with-low-vitamin-D-levels-recover-muscle-strength-faster--e96650685b614f10a9af4c20382fc281?pvs=21), The study indicates that supplemental vitamin D3 improved recovery of peak torque at 48 hours and 7 days post-exercise in humans. Related to Results (1) (Research Papers: Taking spirulina extract for 6 weeks seems to help rowers maintain better immune function after intense rowing exercises, compared to those who didn’t take spirulina. • Partially Agree: The abstract indicates that there was a greater increase in isokinetic knee extensor strength and endurance in the group that took deer antler velvet powder compared to the placebo group. This suggests that the powder form of the supplement had some beneficial effects on certain aspects of strength training.
• Partially Disagree: However, the abstract also states that there were no changes in endocrine markers, red cell mass, or VO2max in any of the groups. Additionally, all groups, including the placebo, improved 6 RM strength equivalently. This implies that deer antler velvet (both extract and powder) did not enhance maximal aerobic performance or significantly impact other markers of exercise performance across the board. Label: Exercise Perfomance,Stress,Cortisol,Muscle Damage,Oxidative Stress
Related to Results (1) (Research Papers: The abstract demonstrates that Mg-orotate supplementation statistically improved stress responses in athletes. This is indicated by the lower serum cortisol levels in the Mg-orotate group both before and after the test compared to the control group. Cortisol is a hormone associated with stress, and lower levels suggest a reduced stress response. (https://www.notion.so/The-abstract-demonstrates-that-Mg-orotate-supplementation-statistically-improved-stress-responses-in-21fcba0d9c0a43dca3fbb909f1bf3e29?pvs=21), Competitive triathletes who took Mg-orotate supplements for 4 weeks performed better in a triathlon, had favorable changes in various blood measurements indicating better energy use and reduced stress, compared to those who took a placebo. (https://www.notion.so/Competitive-triathletes-who-took-Mg-orotate-supplements-for-4-weeks-performed-better-in-a-triathlon--3147075af0744df9848e01aab0ee8ee7?pvs=21), While the abstract does not directly measure oxidative stress, certain indicators hint at its potential impact. The increase in venous O2 partial pressure was higher in the Mg-orotate group (208%) compared to the control group (126%), suggesting enhanced oxygen utilization which can be linked to oxidative processes. However, without direct measures of oxidative stress markers, such as reactive oxygen species or antioxidant levels, a definitive conclusion cannot be drawn. (https://www.notion.so/While-the-abstract-does-not-directly-measure-oxidative-stress-certain-indicators-hint-at-its-potent-e15e00e6a6d94ffaa13512f23d9cbc29?pvs=21), The abstract demonstrates that Mg-orotate supplementation statistically improved stress responses in athletes. This is indicated by the lower serum cortisol levels in the Mg-orotate group both before and after the test compared to the control group. Cortisol is a hormone associated with stress, and lower levels suggest a reduced stress response. (https://www.notion.so/The-abstract-demonstrates-that-Mg-orotate-supplementation-statistically-improved-stress-responses-in-664177d2b5544d0c8d0119cc8618c054?pvs=21), The abstract suggests that Mg-orotate supplementation may have benefited in reducing muscle damage. This inference is based on the lesser increase in creatine kinase (CK) catalytic concentration after the test in the Mg-orotate group (122% increase) compared to the control group (140% increase). CK is often used as an indicator of muscle damage, so a lower increase implies less muscle damage. (https://www.notion.so/The-abstract-suggests-that-Mg-orotate-supplementation-may-have-benefited-in-reducing-muscle-damage--10773cbf8eda4c2d851459128dbe305b?pvs=21)

Label: Exercise Perfomance,Mood
Related to Results (1) (Research Papers: The abstract indicates that the combination of concurrent training (CT) and Eurycoma longifolia (EL), also known as Tongkat Ali, supplementation statistically improved exercise performance. This is evidenced by the increased isokinetic peak torque of knee extensors in both the CT (14%) and CT + EL (17%) groups (p = 0.040; p = 0.006, respectively). Additionally, an increase in isokinetic peak torque of knee flexion was observed in the CT + EL group only (p < 0.05). (https://www.notion.so/The-abstract-indicates-that-the-combination-of-concurrent-training-CT-and-Eurycoma-longifolia-EL--7932401536e44dc59d7379a4ba29457d?pvs=21), The abstract suggests that both CT alone and CT combined with EL supplementation benefited mood, as indicated by the decreased symptomatology of Androgen Deficiency in the Aging Male (ADAM) in the CT (27.3%) and CT + EL (36.1%) groups (p = 0.005). The reduction in ADAM symptomatology can be correlated with improvements in mood and overall well-being. (https://www.notion.so/The-abstract-suggests-that-both-CT-alone-and-CT-combined-with-EL-supplementation-benefited-mood-as--4105b349ce87433a879b07d078bcb76a?pvs=21)

Results: The abstract indicates that the combination of concurrent training (CT) and Eurycoma longifolia (EL), also known as Tongkat Ali, supplementation statistically improved exercise performance. This is evidenced by the increased isokinetic peak torque of knee extensors in both the CT (14%) and CT + EL (17%) groups (p = 0.040; p = 0.006, respectively). Additionally, an increase in isokinetic peak torque of knee flexion was observed in the CT + EL group only (p < 0.05). (https://www.notion.so/The-abstract-indicates-that-the-combination-of-concurrent-training-CT-and-Eurycoma-longifolia-EL--3a9a2b92ab354308bcaf1544d39d7cf4?pvs=21), The abstract suggests that both CT alone and CT combined with EL supplementation benefited mood, as indicated by the decreased symptomatology of Androgen Deficiency in the Aging Male (ADAM) in the CT (27.3%) and CT + EL (36.1%) groups (p = 0.005). The reduction in ADAM symptomatology can be correlated with improvements in mood and overall well-being. (https://www.notion.so/The-abstract-suggests-that-both-CT-alone-and-CT-combined-with-EL-supplementation-benefited-mood-as--a7ed19e1674e466da3151cd86fb56ed6?pvs=21)

Related to Results (1) (Research Papers: Patients with HE treated with ALC showed a decrease in the severity of both mental and physical fatigue and an increase in physical activity. Blood ammonia levels are related to liver function, as the liver is responsible for detoxifying ammonia. This is evidenced by better scores in the 7-day Physical Activity Recall questionnaire and the Short Physical Performance Battery in the HE1 group, as well as improvements in the 6-minute walk test in the HE2 group. These findings indicate that ALC supplementation had a positive impact on exercise performance in patients with mild and moderate hepatoencephalopathy. (https://www.notion.so/The-study-shows-that-patients-with-hepatic-encephalopathy-HE-treated-with-acetyl-L-carnitine-ALC--1e7a3697d40f4cb9ac605087640ea3f0?pvs=21), Patients with HE treated with ALC showed a decrease in the severity of both mental and physical fatigue and an increase in physical activity. Label: Exercise Perfomance,Mitochondrial Function
Related to Results (1) (Research Papers: The study suggests that nitrate supplementation improved mitochondrial function in hypoxic conditions. This conclusion is based on the observed reduction in muscle metabolic perturbation during exercise and the restoration of exercise tolerance and oxidative function to levels seen in normoxia. Label: Exercise Perfomance,Mitochondrial Function
Related to Results (1) (Research Papers: The study suggests that dietary nitrate supplementation benefited mitochondrial function in hypoxic conditions. Label: Exercise Perfomance
Related to Results (1) (Research Papers: : L-citrulline-malate supplementation appears to have had a positive impact on certain metabolic parameters related to exercise performance. The supplementation significantly increased the plasma concentrations of citrulline, arginine, ornithine, urea, creatinine, and nitrite (p < 0.05), which are involved in the metabolic handling of amino acids and the production of arginine-derived metabolites. These changes suggest enhanced amino acid utilization and increased production of metabolites beneficial for exercise performance. Additionally, growth hormone increase was higher in the supplemented group post-exercise (p < 0.05), indicating a potential enhancement in exercise-related hormonal response. These factors collectively suggest a positive effect of L-citrulline-malate supplementation on exercise performance, particularly in the context of endurance cycling. (https://www.notion.so/L-citrulline-malate-supplementation-appears-to-have-had-a-positive-impact-on-certain-metabolic-param-79713cc0b18745f4ba40405ec2be88a1?pvs=21)

TLDR: For women aged 18 to 40 with polycystic ovary syndrome, taking carnitine every day for 12 weeks significantly improved thickness levels of the wall of their neck arteries (which is good) and increased beneficial nitric oxide in the blood, but it didn't affect inflammation markers in the blood.

Related to Results (1) (Research Papers: The study found that ginseng administration at the prescribed dose exhibited training-like effects on VO2 max, anaerobic power (AP), and leg muscle strength. Label: Exercise Perfomance
Related to Results (1) (Research Papers: The abstract supports the notion that capsaicin ingestion (150 mg) statistically improved certain aspects of exercise performance. Specifically, capsaicin significantly induced a lower respiratory gas exchange ratio [0.92 (0.02) versus 0.94 (0.02), p < 0.05] and higher fat oxidation [0.17 (0.04) g/min versus 0.12 (0.04) g/min, p < 0.05] during exercise at 50% of maximal ventilatory threshold (50% VT(max)). These results indicate enhanced substrate oxidation, which is a positive aspect of exercise performance. However, it's important to note that there were no significant differences in heart rate or autonomic nervous activity during exercise between the capsaicin and placebo trials. (https://www.notion.so/The-abstract-supports-the-notion-that-capsaicin-ingestion-150-mg-statistically-improved-certain-as-918b10019541430999b0c4d4e706daf6?pvs=21)
Untitled (https://www.notion.so/b0fbf5631254414d96a1f6d6e3a5ae86?pvs=21)

Label: Exercise Perfomance
Related to Results (1) (Research Papers: The abstract does not support the conclusion that caffeine statistically improved exercise performance in the context of lactate, ventilatory, and heart rate variability thresholds during progressive exercise. Although caffeine increased some physiological parameters at rest (such as blood lactate, oxygen consumption, carbon dioxide production, and minute ventilation), these changes did not translate into significant improvements in the key performance metrics during exercise. The only noted difference during exercise was higher minute ventilation volumes in caffeine trials, but other parameters (including lactate, ventilatory, and heart rate variability thresholds) did not show significant differences compared to placebo tests. Thus, the data suggest that while caffeine alters some physiological responses at rest, it does not significantly enhance exercise performance in terms of the specific metrics evaluated in this study. (https://www.notion.so/The-abstract-does-not-support-the-conclusion-that-caffeine-statistically-improved-exercise-performan-47683e5b0a594d36a7152f7e23984bc5?pvs=21)
Results: The abstract does not support the conclusion that caffeine statistically improved exercise performance in the context of lactate, ventilatory, and heart rate variability thresholds during progressive exercise. The only noted difference during exercise was higher minute ventilation volumes in caffeine trials, but other parameters (including lactate, ventilatory, and heart rate variability thresholds) did not show significant differences compared to placebo tests. TLDR: This research looked at how l-carnitine affects people with serious kidney disease who are on dialysis. It found that l-carnitine can lower some blood markers like LDL and CRP, which is a good thing. But, it didn’t make a difference to other blood markers, and it didn’t have any bad effects. The study included a lot of people with this kind of kidney disease.

Label: Exercise Perfomance,Mitochondrial Function
Related to Results (1) (Research Papers: The abstract indicates that L-carnitine supplementation statistically improved exercise performance in patients with peripheral vascular disease. This is evidenced by a significant increase in the absolute walking distance on a treadmill test, rising from 174 ± 63 meters with placebo to 306 ± 122 meters with L-carnitine (p < .01). (https://www.notion.so/The-abstract-indicates-that-L-carnitine-supplementation-statistically-improved-exercise-performance--308888189b7c473685abbba65d354732?pvs=21), The abstract suggests that L-carnitine improved mitochondrial function, as inferred from the increase in total carnitine levels in ischemic muscle biopsy and the reduced increase in popliteal venous lactate concentration after exercise (107 ± 16% before treatment vs. 54 ± 32% after carnitine, p < .01). These findings suggest enhanced mitochondrial efficiency in utilizing lactate, a byproduct of muscle metabolism, indicating improved mitochondrial function. (https://www.notion.so/The-abstract-suggests-that-L-carnitine-improved-mitochondrial-function-as-inferred-from-the-increas-0afb23c4689e4a8aa9e892f57de2815a?pvs=21)

Label: Exercise Perfomance
Related to Results (1) (Research Papers: The study found no significant differences in performance times between trials in highly trained swimmers after creatine supplementation. Despite the expected ergogenic effects of creatine, this particular study did not observe an improvement in sprint swimming performance as a result of the creatine supplementation regimen (5 g creatine monohydrate 4 times per day for 5 days). Therefore, based on this study, creatine supplementation cannot be considered a beneficial aid for improving exercise performance in the context of sprint swimming. Related to Results (1) (Research Papers: While the study supports the use of creatine for improved sprint performance, it does not suggest any benefits for endurance-type exercise performance. This improvement in sprint performance aligns with the expected benefits of creatine supplementation in enhancing high-intensity exercise capacity. However, it's important to note that the study found no effect of creatine supplementation on whole-body and muscle oxidative capacity, substrate utilization, and time-trial performance during endurance cycling exercise. The increase in body mass observed following creatine loading, maintained after 6 weeks, was accounted for by a corresponding increase in fat-free mass. While the study supports the use of creatine for improved sprint performance, it does not suggest any benefits for endurance-type exercise performance. Label: Exercise Perfomance
Related to Results (1) (Research Papers: The study found that chromium supplementation did not significantly improve glycogen synthesis during recovery from high-intensity exercise in overweight men. Both the chromium-supplemented group and the placebo group showed similar rates of glycogen synthesis after exercise (Chromium: 25.8 ± 8.0 mmol/kg/h and Placebo: 17.1 ± 4.7 mmol/kg/h). Additionally, there was no significant difference in elevations in glucose and insulin during recovery between the two groups. The study did observe a trend for lower phosphatidylinositol 3-kinase (PI 3-kinase) activity in the chromium group, but this did not lead to a statistically significant improvement in exercise performance or recovery. Therefore, based on this study, chromium supplementation cannot be considered beneficial for enhancing exercise performance in terms of glycogen synthesis during recovery. (https://www.notion.so/The-study-found-that-chromium-supplementation-did-not-significantly-improve-glycogen-synthesis-durin-1ec8acbf47914395b307d907fe2dc1e6?pvs=21)
Untitled (https://www.notion.so/2bea82bab1444babb176cb381db549ac?pvs=21)

Label: Exercise Perfomance,Mitochondrial Function
Related to Results (1) (Research Papers: Coenzyme Q(10) (CoQ(10)) treatment showed beneficial effects in terms of exercise performance in patients with mitochondrial cytopathy. The study reports that CoQ(10) treatment attenuated the rise in lactate after cycle ergometry and increased VO(2)/kg lean mass after 5 minutes of cycling (approximately 1.93 ml, P < 0.005). This indicates an improvement in aerobic capacity during exercise, suggesting a positive impact on exercise performance. (https://www.notion.so/Coenzyme-Q-10-CoQ-10-treatment-showed-beneficial-effects-in-terms-of-exercise-performance-in-pat-9a517456a3d2458ca91ef80c3df3dafd?pvs=21)
Untitled (https://www.notion.so/316fef0b8a51434096073896cd7edcf7?pvs=21), Untitled (https://www.notion.so/e3d50aa226124e1da9769d530b31d9d1?pvs=21)
Results: Coenzyme Q(10) (CoQ(10)) treatment showed beneficial effects in terms of exercise performance in patients with mitochondrial cytopathy. The study reports that CoQ(10) treatment attenuated the rise in lactate after cycle ergometry and increased VO(2)/kg lean mass after 5 minutes of cycling (approximately 1.93 ml, P < 0.005). This indicates an improvement in aerobic capacity during exercise, suggesting a positive impact on exercise performance. (https://www.notion.so/Coenzyme-Q-10-CoQ-10-treatment-showed-beneficial-effects-in-terms-of-exercise-performance-in-pat-2fd6eda99155490c9ab4d40d4d0cc17e?pvs=21), While the study does not directly measure mitochondrial function, the observed effects of CoQ(10) on exercise-induced lactate production and VO(2) changes are indicative of improved mitochondrial efficiency in energy production during exercise. The decrease in gray matter choline-containing compounds (P < 0.05) could also imply a beneficial effect on brain metabolism, which is closely linked to mitochondrial function. However, the study did not demonstrate significant effects on other clinically relevant variables such as muscle strength or resting lactate levels, indicating that the improvement in mitochondrial function may be limited to specific areas. (https://www.notion.so/While-the-study-does-not-directly-measure-mitochondrial-function-the-observed-effects-of-CoQ-10-on-aa2ec7563fd846faa8127bac54cf3cd7?pvs=21)

Label: Exercise Perfomance,Mitochondrial Function
Related to Results (1) (Research Papers: The improvement in high-intensity anaerobic and aerobic type activities could indirectly suggest an enhancement in mitochondrial function, as creatine supplementation is known to increase muscle phosphocreatine (PCr), which plays a crucial role in energy metabolism within the mitochondria. Label: Exercise Perfomance
Related to Results (1) (Research Papers: The study found that acute creatine loading (25 g per day for 4 days) improved swimming performance significantly in elite swimmers when assessed by maximal interval sessions. The mean average interval swim times improved from 44.3±16.5 seconds before supplementation to 43.7±16.3 seconds after supplementation (P<0.01). However, after 2 months of longer-term creatine supplementation (5 g of creatine per day), there was no significant change in swimming performance compared to the placebo group. The results indicate that while short-term, high-dose creatine supplementation can enhance swimming performance, longer-term supplementation at a lower dose does not maintain these performance benefits. (https://www.notion.so/The-study-found-that-acute-creatine-loading-25-g-per-day-for-4-days-improved-swimming-performance--476e5105126944eeb4b2a1a1b8a6828a?pvs=21)
Untitled (https://www.notion.so/88d125439fe54490b5320ad2d0f8d972?pvs=21)

Label: Pain,Joint Function,Inflammation
Related to Results (1) (Research Papers: Glu and MSM, both individually and combined, significantly helped reduce osteoarthritis symptoms such as pain and swelling. The combination of both was more effective and faster in providing relief. (https://www.notion.so/Glu-and-MSM-both-individually-and-combined-significantly-helped-reduce-osteoarthritis-symptoms-suc-b843daccce2546cb9feb5379c5359f22?pvs=21), : The abstract does not provide specific percentage data directly related to inflammation. However, it mentions a significant decrease in the swelling index with Glucosamine (Glu), Methylsulfonylmethane (MSM), and their combination compared to placebo. Specifically, the combination therapy showed a greater decrease in the swelling index from 1.43 +/- 0.63 to 0.14 +/- 0.35 (p < 0.05) after 12 weeks. This suggests an improvement in inflammation symptoms, but without specific percentage data, a definitive agreement cannot be established. (https://www.notion.so/The-abstract-does-not-provide-specific-percentage-data-directly-related-to-inflammation-However-it-e735afe80b7646caa92f87f0a07e548f?pvs=21)

TLDR: In this study, two kinds of medicines made from plants were tested on adults aged 40 to 70 who have joint pain due to a disease called osteoarthritis. The medicines were given three times a day for three months. Both medicines helped the patients move better. One of the medicines also significantly helped to reduce their joint pain. There were no side effects from either medicine.
